meanings.definition: The action of prohibiting or forbidding something.
meanings.sent1: The interdictions from the teacher prevented us from using our phones in class.
meanings.sent2: The government imposed interdictions on smoking in public places.
meanings.sent3: The interdictions on eating cookies before dinner made the kids sneak them in secret.
meanings.sent4: Her strict interdictions on late-night TV watching were like a fortress around bedtime.
meanings.sent5: The interdictions on playing with fire were a safety measure to prevent accidents.

meanings.definition: A prohibition or restriction imposed by authority.
meanings.sent1: The interdictions by the principal kept the students in line during the assembly.
meanings.sent2: The interdictions on parking in certain areas were clearly marked with signs.
meanings.sent3: The interdictions on wearing hats indoors made the students feel like rebels when they snuck them in.
meanings.sent4: The interdictions on using cell phones during the exam were a barrier to cheating.
meanings.sent5: The interdictions on bringing pets to school were a rule that everyone followed.
